Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 08:20PM - edited Apr 19, 2008 08:21PM by gg44 I had a core biopsy to check for cancer then I had a lumpectomy to get the rest of the cancer with SNB and  then I had to go back for re excision. They finally got clear margins. I did out patient on all three and didn't have drains. I am doing just fine.The only restrictions I have is not to lift anything over 10 pounds with that arm. Some have drains and some don't. Maybe you won't.

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 04:28PM gg44 wrote: Hi, I had my surgery yesterday and got the results today.GOOD NEWS: CLEAN MARGINS ALL THE WAY. Thank you everyone for your support. I am in very little pain this time. Here is hoping every body else gets the same good news. I am pulling for you.
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 09:23AM - edited Apr 5, 2008 07:55PM by gg44 I had a lumpectomy with 4 sentinal nodes removed on April 1st. I was out patient. Nodes came back neg but my margins on one side  was pos. SOOO back to surgery on 15th for re excisions to try to get clear margins. I had clear tracer instead of the blue dye. I was glad of that. I am begining to feel like a pin cushion!!!!! I only have steristrips on my incisions. I am a little sore but not bad. I don't have a drain tube of any kind. I really feel blessed !!!!! Good luck to all.

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 03:40PM - edited Apr 16, 2008 07:31PM by gg44 I had a lumpectomy and snb. I didn't have any nausea or dizziness. Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 11:20AM gg44 wrote: I had my surgery on the 1st and I feel great. My 4 lymph nodes were neg but the margins on one side was pos. No problem I will just go get the clear margin on that side. No chemo for me. I don't have a drain and no bandages just steristrips. Sheduled for reincision on 15th. Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 01:42AM - edited Mar 31, 2008 01:44AM by gg44 Thank you. I have a really super surgeon. She is up to date on all the newest things. I am really not worried too much. I see where all these wonderful people have come through and that is very encouraging and eases any worries that I might have.I have two special things going for me that day, That is my mom's birthday and I have her name. She passed away in 1965 so I feel like I have her close by me in this.I will be on an outpatient  bases.

Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 01:04AM - edited May 6, 2008 01:05AM by gg44 When I went to get my mammogram they did an ultrasound also. I had a small smooth cyst and was told it didn't look like cancer but they scheduled me for a core needle biopsy with ultrasound. It was'nt all that painful and only took about 15 minutes for set up and all. It did come back as idc and dcis. They made sure I had no pain.Good luck with yours.
